long_description: The Northwest Forest Pass is honored at all day use, standard amenity recreation fee sites managed by the Forest Service in national forests in Washington and Oregon. Valid at the following national forests: Columbia River Gorge, Colville, Deschutes, Fremont-Winema, Gifford Pinchot, Malheur, Mount Baker-Snoqualmie, Mount Hood, and Ochoco. Also includes the Okanogan and Wenatchee, Olympic, Rogue River-Siskiyou, Siuslaw, Umatilla, Umpqua, Wallowa-Whitman and Willamette. Pass admits pass holder and any accompanying passengers in a private vehicle. Admits pass holder at per person sites. Other members in party must pay the per-person fee. Pass is valid from 1 year from the last day of the month issued. Northwest Forest Pass is non-transferable and non-refundable; REI members do not earn a dividend on the purchase of this pass.
short_description: The Northwest Forest Pass is honored at all day use, standard amenity recreation fee sites managed by the Forest Service in national forests in Washington and Oregon.
